item.text: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged severely.

The <st data-num="4757" class="">soldiers</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="4120" class="">braided</st><n id="2" /> a <st data-num="4735" class="">crown</st> <st data-num="1537" class="">of</st> <st data-num="173" class="">thorns</st><n id="3" /> and <st data-num="2007" class="">put</st> it <st data-num="2007" class="">on</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="2776" class="">head</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> they <st data-num="4016" class="">clothed</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> in a <st data-num="4210" class="">purple</st> <st data-num="2440" class="">robe</st>.<n id="4" />
They came up to him again and again and said, “Hail, king of the Jews!” And they struck him repeatedly in the face.
Again Pilate went out and said to the Jewish leaders, “Look, I am bringing him out to you, so that you may know that I find no reason for an accusation against him.”

<st data-num="3767" class="">So</st> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="1831" class="">came</st> <st data-num="1854" class="">outside</st>, <st data-num="5409" class="">wearing</st> the <st data-num="4735" class="">crown</st> of <st data-num="174" class="">thorns</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="4210" class="">purple</st> <st data-num="2440" class="">robe</st>.<n id="1" /> Pilate<n id="2" /> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="846" class="">them</st>, “<st data-num="2400">Look</st>, here is the <st data-num="444" class="">man</st>!”<n id="3" />

<st data-num="3753" class="">When</st> the <st data-num="749">chief priests</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> their <st data-num="5257" class="">officers</st> <st data-num="1492" class="">saw</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>, they <st data-num="2905">shouted out</st>, “<st data-num="4717" class="">Crucify</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>! <st data-num="4717" class="">Crucify</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>!”<n id="2" /> <st data-num="4091" class="">Pilate</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st>,<n id="3" /> “<st data-num="4771">You</st> <st data-num="2983" class="">take</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="4717" class="">crucify</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>!<n id="4" /> <st data-num="1063" class="">Certainly</st><n id="5" /> <st data-num="1473" class="">I</st> <st data-num="2147" class="">find</st> <st data-num="3756">no</st> <st data-num="156">reason for an accusation</st><n id="6" /> <st data-num="1722" class="">against</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st>!”
The Jewish leaders replied, “We have a law, and according to our law he ought to die because he claimed to be the Son of God!”
When Pilate heard what they said, he was more afraid than ever,

<st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> he <st data-num="1525">went back</st> <st data-num="1519" class="">into</st> the <st data-num="4232">governor’s residence</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st>, “<st data-num="4159">Where</st> do <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="1510">come</st> <st data-num="4159">from</st>?” <st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="1325" class="">gave</st> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="3756" class="">no</st> <st data-num="612" class="">answer</st>.

<st data-num="3767" class="">So</st> <st data-num="4091" class="">Pilate</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st>,<n id="1" /> “Do you <st data-num="3756" class="">refuse</st> to <st data-num="2980" class="">speak</st> to <st data-num="1473" class="">me</st>? <st data-num="3756">Don’t</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="1492" class="">know</st> I <st data-num="2192" class="">have</st> the <st data-num="1849" class="">authority</st><n id="2" /> to <st data-num="630" class="">release</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> to <st data-num="4717" class="">crucify</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st>?”<n id="3" />
Jesus replied, “You would have no authority over me at all, unless it was given to you from above. Therefore the one who handed me over to you is guilty of greater sin.”
From this point on, Pilate tried to release him. But the Jewish leaders shouted out, “If you release this man, you are no friend of Caesar! Everyone who claims to be a king opposes Caesar!”
When Pilate heard these words he brought Jesus outside and sat down on the judgment seat in the place called “The Stone Pavement” (Gabbatha in Aramaic).
(Now it was the day of preparation for the Passover, about noon.) Pilate said to the Jewish leaders, “Look, here is your king!”
Then they shouted out, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!” Pilate asked, “Shall I crucify your king?” The high priests replied, “We have no king except Caesar!”

Then Pilate handed him over to them to be crucified.

So they took Jesus,
and carrying his own cross he went out to the place called “The Place of the Skull” (called in Aramaic Golgotha).

<st data-num="3699" class="">There</st> they<n id="1" /> <st data-num="4717" class="">crucified</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="846" class="">him</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">along</st> <st data-num="3326" class="">with</st> <st data-num="1417" class="">two</st> <st data-num="243" class="">others</st>,<n id="3" /> one <st data-num="1782" class="">on each side</st>, with <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="3319">in the middle</st>.

<st data-num="4091" class="">Pilate</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">also</st> <st data-num="5087" class="">had</st> a <st data-num="5102" class="">notice</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="1125" class="">written</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5087" class="">fastened</st> <st data-num="1909" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="4716" class="">cross</st>,<n id="2" /> which <st data-num="1125" class="">read:</st><n id="3" /> “<st data-num="2424">Jesus</st> the <st data-num="3480" class="">Nazarene</st>, the <st data-num="935" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st>.”

<st data-num="3767" class="">Thus</st> <st data-num="4183" class="">many</st> of the <st data-num="2453">Jewish residents of Jerusalem</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="314" class="">read</st> this <st data-num="5102">notice</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="3754" class="">because</st> the <st data-num="5117" class="">place</st> <st data-num="3699" class="">where</st> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> <st data-num="4717" class="">crucified</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> <st data-num="1451" class="">near</st> the <st data-num="4172" class="">city</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the notice <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> <st data-num="1125" class="">written</st> in <st data-num="1447" class="">Aramaic</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="4515" class="">Latin</st>, and <st data-num="1676" class="">Greek</st>.

<st data-num="3767" class="">Then</st> the <st data-num="749">chief priests</st> of the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="3004">said</st> to <st data-num="4091" class="">Pilate</st>, “Do <st data-num="3361" class="">not</st> <st data-num="1125" class="">write</st>, ‘The <st data-num="935" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews,’</st> <st data-num="235" class="">but</st> rather, ‘<st data-num="1565">This man</st> <st data-num="3004">said</st>, I <st data-num="1510" class="">am</st> <st data-num="935" class="">king</st> of the <st data-num="2453" class="">Jews.’</st>”
Pilate answered, “What I have written, I have written.”

Now when the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and made four shares, one for each soldier, and the tunic remained. (Now the tunic was seamless, woven from top to bottom as a single piece.)

So the soldiers said to one another, “Let’s not tear it, but throw dice to see who will get it.” This took place to fulfill the scripture that says, “They divided my garments among them, and for my clothing they threw dice.” So the soldiers did these things.
Now standing beside Jesus’ cross were his mother, his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

<st data-num="3767" class="">So</st> when <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> <st data-num="1492" class="">saw</st> his <st data-num="3384" class="">mother</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="3101" class="">disciple</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">whom</st> he <st data-num="25" class="">loved</st> <st data-num="3936">standing there</st>, he <st data-num="3004" class="">said</st> to his <st data-num="3384" class="">mother</st>, “<st data-num="1135">Woman</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="2396">look</st>, here is <st data-num="4771" class="">your</st> <st data-num="5207" class="">son</st>!”
He then said to his disciple, “Look, here is your mother!” From that very time the disciple took her into his own home.
After this Jesus, realizing that by this time everything was completed, said (in order to fulfill the scripture), “I am thirsty!”

A <st data-num="4632" class="">jar</st> <st data-num="3324" class="">full</st> of <st data-num="3690" class="">sour wine</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="2749">was there</st>, so they <st data-num="4060">put</st> a <st data-num="4699" class="">sponge</st> <st data-num="3324" class="">soaked</st> in <st data-num="3690" class="">sour wine</st> <st data-num="4060">on</st> a branch of <st data-num="5301" class="">hyssop</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="4374">lifted</st> it<n id="3" /> to <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="4750" class="">mouth</st>.
When he had received the sour wine, Jesus said, “It is completed!” Then he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.

Then because it was the day of preparation, so that the bodies should not stay on the crosses on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was an especially important one), the Jewish leaders asked Pilate to have the victims’ legs broken and the bodies taken down.

<st data-num="3767" class="">So</st> the <st data-num="4757" class="">soldiers</st> <st data-num="2064" class="">came</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="2608" class="">broke</st> the <st data-num="4628" class="">legs</st> of the two men who had been <st data-num="4957">crucified<n id="1" /> with</st> <st data-num="846" class="">Jesus</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="4413" class="">first</st> the one <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> then the <st data-num="243" class="">other</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="1161" class="">But</st> <st data-num="5613" class="">when</st> they <st data-num="2064" class="">came</st> <st data-num="1909">to</st> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus</st> and <st data-num="1492" class="">saw</st> that <st data-num="846" class="">he</st> was <st data-num="2235" class="">already</st> <st data-num="2348" class="">dead</st>, they did <st data-num="3756" class="">not</st> <st data-num="2608" class="">break</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="4628" class="">legs</st>.

<st data-num="235" class="">But</st> <st data-num="1520" class="">one</st> of the <st data-num="4757" class="">soldiers</st> <st data-num="3572" class="">pierced</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="4125" class="">side</st> with a <st data-num="3057" class="">spear</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="129" class="">blood</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="5204" class="">water</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1831">flowed out</st> <st data-num="2117" class="">immediately</st>.

<st data-num="2532" class="">And</st> the person who <st data-num="3708" class="">saw</st> it<n id="1" /> has <st data-num="3140" class="">testified</st> (<st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="846" class="">his</st> <st data-num="3141" class="">testimony</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="228" class="">true</st>, <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1565" class="">he</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="1492" class="">knows</st> <st data-num="3754">that</st> <st data-num="1565" class="">he</st> <st data-num="1510" class="">is</st> <st data-num="3004" class="">telling</st> the <st data-num="227">truth</st>),<n id="3" /> <st data-num="2443">so that</st> <st data-num="4771" class="">you</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">also</st> may <st data-num="4100" class="">believe</st>.
For these things happened so that the scripture would be fulfilled, “Not a bone of his will be broken.”
And again another scripture says, “They will look on the one whom they have pierced.”

After this, Joseph of Arimathea, a disciple of Jesus (but secretly because he feared the Jewish leaders), asked Pilate if he could remove the body of Jesus. Pilate gave him permission, so he went and took the body away.

<st data-num="3530" class="">Nicodemus</st>, the man who had <st data-num="4413" class="">previously</st> <st data-num="2064" class="">come</st> <st data-num="4314" class="">to</st> <st data-num="846" class="">Jesus</st><n id="1" /> at <st data-num="3571" class="">night</st>,<n id="2" /> accompanied Joseph,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="5342" class="">carrying</st> a <st data-num="3395" class="">mixture</st> of <st data-num="4666" class="">myrrh</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="250" class="">aloes</st><n id="4" /> weighing <st data-num="5613" class="">about</st> <st data-num="1540" class="">75</st> <st data-num="3046" class="">pounds</st>.<n id="5" />

<st data-num="3767" class="">Then</st> they <st data-num="2983" class="">took</st> <st data-num="2424" class="">Jesus’</st> <st data-num="4983" class="">body</st> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1210" class="">wrapped</st> <st data-num="846" class="">it</st>, <st data-num="3326" class="">with</st> the <st data-num="759">aromatic spices</st>,<n id="1" /> in <st data-num="3608">strips of linen cloth</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="2531">according to</st> <st data-num="2453" class="">Jewish</st> <st data-num="1779" class="">burial</st> <st data-num="1485" class="">customs</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="1161" class="">Now</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">at</st> the <st data-num="5117" class="">place</st> <st data-num="3699">where</st> Jesus<n id="1" /> <st data-num="1510" class="">was</st> <st data-num="4717" class="">crucified</st><n id="2" /> there was a <st data-num="2779" class="">garden</st>,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="2532" class="">and</st> <st data-num="1722" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="2779" class="">garden</st><n id="4" /> was a <st data-num="2537" class="">new</st> <st data-num="3419" class="">tomb</st> <st data-num="3739" class="">where</st> <st data-num="3762" class="">no one</st> had <st data-num="3764" class="">yet</st> been <st data-num="5087" class="">buried</st>.<n id="5" />
And so, because it was the Jewish day of preparation and the tomb was nearby, they placed Jesus’ body there.
